Saturday and Sunday, Sep. 20-21, 2025 | Times Vary Live Wildly Showcase (904) 209-0367 25 W. Castillo Drive St. Augustine, FL 32084 View Google Map Share This +1 more The Sing Out Loud Festival presents a two-day concert at Francis Field , with multiple performers, including dream-pop artist Beabadoobee, singer-songwriter Father John Misty, and star musician David Kushner on Saturday. Sunday's lineup includes the blues duo Teskey Brothers, indie rock band Rilo Kiley, and singer Gigi Perez. The Live Wildly Showcase is one event of many in the September 2025 Sing Out Loud Festival. The festival recognizes St. Augustine's favorite local artists, as well as those who are known on national and international stages. This two-day event at Francis Field brings more than a dozen world and nationally acclaimed acts to St. Augustine. Beabadoobee Performance Start and Gate Opening Times These 2024 times will be updated as we learn more. On Saturday , the music started at 1:30 p.m. and stopped at 11:00 p.m. The early entry gate opened at 12:00 noon, and the general admission gate opened at 12:30 p.m. On Sunday , the music started at 1:00 p.m. and stopped at 10:00 p.m. The early entry gate opened at 12:30 p.m., and the general admission gate opened at 1:00 p.m. Saturday, September 20, 2025 Headliner: David Kuschner Other Acts: Beabadoobee Vance Joy Father John Misty Maren Morris Sarah Kinsley Hozier Sunday, September 21, 2025 Headliner: Hozier Other Acts: The Teskey Brothers Rilo Kiley Gigi Perez sombr Brenn! Tickets Admission: Prices range from $205.00 for one-day General Admission to $835.00 for two-day Platinum When: Saturday, September 20, 2025, from 1:30 - 11:00 p.m. and Sunday, September 21, 2025, from 1:00 - 10:00 p.m. Where: Francis Field, 25 W Castillo Drive, St. Augustine, Florida 32084. For more information or tickets, call (904) 209-3746 or visit the St. Augustine Amphitheatre Sing Out Loud Festival. Parking The following information is from 2024; we will update this as we learn more. The Downtown Parking Garage will be closed to the public from 11:00 p.m. on Friday, September 20 through Monday, September 23. Free Shuttle Service to the Visitor Information Center (just steps from Francis Field) will be provided during the Francis Field Showcase on September 21 and 22. The parking lots are: Broudy's Lot, 198 and 212 West King Street, at the corner of US1 and King Street — Saturday and Sunday, from 8:00 a.m. to midnight. St. Johns County Health Department, 200 San Sebastian View — Saturday and Sunday, from 11:00 a.m. until midnight. San Marco Lot, 301 San Marco Avenue — Saturday and Sunday from 11:00 a.m. until midnight. STAR Circulator : The STAR Circulator, around downtown St. Augustine, will run on an adjusted schedule from noon to midnight on both Saturday and Sunday. There will be no event parking at the Historic Downtown Parking Garage. The top two floors will be available for event staff. The first two floors will be accessible to the event attendees and the general public during an extreme weather emergency. Street Closures The City of St. Augustine will redirect traffic, beginning at 5:00 p.m. on Friday, September 20 continuing through 6:00 a.m. on Monday, September 23. Here are the road closures: Cordova Street , North from Orange Street to the entrance of the parking garage Closed Friday at 5:00 p.m. through Monday at 6:00 a.m. Castillo Drive eastbound Closed Friday at 11:00 p.m. through Monday at 6:00 a.m. Castillo Drive westbound from San Marco Closed Saturday at 11:00 a.m. through Sunday at 1:00 a.m. Closed Sunday at 11:00 a.m. through Monday at 1:00 a.m. Orange Street Closed to through traffic Friday at 5:00 p.m. through Monday at 6:00 a.m. There will be security on Orange Street to ensure that residents can get in and out as needed. Sing Out Loud Festival Welcomes Big Names and Local Favorites in Music to Florida’s Historic Coast September 8-October 1 | St. Augustine & Ponte Vedra, FL Skip to content 80 ° F Trip Planner Radio 0 Saved Navigation Things to Do & Attractions History Outdoor Activities Family Fun Free Things to Do Shopping Arts & Culture Golf Sightseeing & Tours Spas & Wellness Paranormal Activities Must-Do Experiences on Florida's Historic Coast Discover the Trails of Florida’s Historic Coast: A Journey of Flavor, Spirits, and History Beaches St. Augustine Beach Ponte Vedra Beach Anastasia State Park Crescent Beach Vilano Beach Mickler’s Landing Butler Beach Explore the Beaches Places to Stay Hotels and Motels on Florida’s Historic Coast Resorts on Florida’s Historic Coast Condos & Private Rentals Campgrounds & RV Parks Bed & Breakfasts Vacation Deals Lodging with Meeting Space Sunkissed Staycations on Florida’s Historic Coast Girlfriend Getaways on Florida’s Historic Coast Golf Food & Drink Restaurants Breweries, Wineries & Distilleries Nightlife Sweet Spots Live Music on Florida’s Historic Coast Music Festivals Live Music Venues Events Submit Event Annual Events Music Festivals Major Holidays This Weekend in St. Augustine: Events & Things to Do Visitor Information Order Guide Subscribe to E-Newsletter Maps Deals Getting Here Parking Visitor Services Weather & Average Temperature Accessibility Medical Assistance Healthy Travel Information & How We Are Open Trip Planner Radio Meetings Religious & Spiritual Retreats Reunions Weddings Tour & Travel Planners Sports Planners Blogs Home Share Sing Out Loud Festival Welcomes Big Names and Local Favorites in Music to Florida’s Historic Coast September 8‑October 1 Tickets are now available for General Admission, General Admission+, and Platinum VIP, plus tons of free community events! Download a PDF of this News Release Contact: Barbara Golden Phone: 904-669-8142 Email: BGolden@FloridasHistoricCoast.com St. Augustine, Fla. (August 1, 2023) – The secret is out. Florida’s Historic Coast is the place to see live music this fall as the Sing Out Loud Festival welcomes The Black Keys, Mumford & Sons, Lord Huron, Maggie Rogers, Yola, War Hippies, Elle King, Amos Lee, S.G. Goodman, Yonder Mountain String Band, Railroad Earth, Keller & Keel, and many other great performances. The multi-day festival features various artists at locales throughout St. Augustine and St. Johns County, Florida. The Sing Out Loud festival begins with the Sing Out Loud Local Showcase. Since 2016, the Local Showcase has placed hundreds of local singers, songwriters, and musicians into the spotlight. With genres ranging from indie rock to bluegrass, hip hop to country, comedy to spoken word, performers are featured at over a dozen venues throughout the festival. These free concerts are a staple of the Sing Out Loud Festival and allow all to explore the vibrant musical landscape of Florida’s Historic Coast. The Local Showcase begins September 8, and features shows every Friday, Saturday, and Sunday through October 1. A listing of concerts and locations is available at www.SingOutLoudFestival.com . Featured events include: Saturday, September 9, The Backyard Stage at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre welcomes Indie rock band Yo La Tengo . This free event is open to all ages and is generously sponsored by Intuition Ale Works. Saturday, September 16, Sing Out Loud Festival’s newest event, Lincolnville Porch Fest , celebrates the unique history of one of St. Augustine’s most historically and culturally significant neighborhoods. Featuring twenty-five local musical acts performing on five porches against the backdrop of the Lincolnville neighborhood, Porch Fest takes place from noon to 5 p.m., culminating with a finale at The Colonial Oak Music Park later in the evening. Tuesday, September 19, artisan shopping and live music take center stage at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre Night Market . This free event takes place from 5 to 9 p.m. and features live music, handmade arts, crafts and goods, and local food trucks. The Sing Out Loud Festival main event, The Francis Field Showcase, takes place Friday, September 22 and Saturday, September 23 at Francis Field in downtown St. Augustine. Two-day tickets include General Admission for $235 each, General Admission+ for $395 each, and Platinum for $760 each. One-day tickets can be purchased at $125 for Friday and $155 for Saturday. Tickets are available online only . Friday, September 22, the Francis Field Showcase will welcome headliners The Black Keys, a Grammy Award-winning American rock duo formed in Akron, Ohio, in 2001, consisting of bandmembers Dan Auerbach and Patrick Carney. The Black Keys are known for songs like “Tighten Up,” “Lonely Boy,” “Howlin’ for You,” and “Fever.” Other performers for that night include indie rock band Lord Huron, English singer-songwriter Yola, and country music duo War Hippies. Saturday, September 23, the Francis Field Showcase will welcome headliners Mumford & Sons, a British folk rock band founded in London in 2007, consisting of members Marcus Mumford, Ted Dwayne, and Ben Lovett. Mumford & Sons are known for tunes like “I Will Wait,” “Little Lion Man,” “The Cave,” and “Hopeless Wanderer.” Other musicians that will take the stage on Saturday night include American singer-songwriter Maggie Rogers, blues rock musician Elle King, folk soul-rocker Amos Lee, and Southern songwriter S.G. Goodman. Saturday, September 23, an exuberant musical experience with Yonder Mountain String Band, Railroad Earth, and Keller & the Keels takes place at The Backyard Stage at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre. Presented in partnership with Relix Magazine, this performance, benefits the Gamble Rogers Folk Festival, Inc. Tickets are $15 and may be purchased online or in person at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre or Ponte Vedra Concert Hall. Music lovers can expand their collections at the St. Augustine Record Fair . This free event takes place 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sunday, September 24 at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre and is one of the area’s largest fairs featuring limited-edition vinyl, 90’s tour posters, vintage rock t-shirts, and even cassette tapes and record players. Friday, September 29 through Sunday, October 1, another foundation of Florida’s Historic Coast’s music scene, the St. Augustine Songwriters Festival celebrates the craft of songwriting. Top-notch country songwriters will perform their hits throughout the St. Augustine’s historic city, accented with the stories and anecdotes behind the hits. These free concerts occur at The Colonial Oak Music Park, Trade Winds Lounge, Prohibition Kitchen, and the St. Augustine Distillery. Introduced in 2016, Sing Out Loud Festival is an annual celebration of live music throughout Florida’s Historic Coast. The Sing Out Loud Festival takes place over multiple weekends in September, and features dozens of musical genres and over one hundred local, regional, and national artists play a mix of free and ticketed shows at venues around the area. The festival is produced by St. Johns County Cultural Events, which curates and operates The St. Augustine Amphitheatre and Ponte Vedra Concert Hall , in partnership with the St. Johns County Tourist Development Council . Guided by its core values of music, community, and philanthropy, Sing Out Loud Festival has welcomed more than 1,300 musicians from around the world while raising over $300,000 for local nonprofit organizations. For images to accompany postings click here. Located midway between Daytona Beach and Jacksonville, Florida’s Historic Coast includes historic St. Augustine, the outstanding golf and seaside elegance of Ponte Vedra Beach, and 42 miles of pristine Atlantic beaches. For more information, call 1.800.653.2489 or go to the Visitors and Convention Bureau website at www.FloridasHistoricCoast.com . EMMA’s mission is to offer quality music and dance performances by national and international artists. They also aim to encourage interest in classical music and to provide opportunities for the youth of St. Johns County. EMMA accomplishes this by offering school concerts in local schools and funding requests from music teachers for instruments and equipment. Historic Florida Militia The Historic Florida Militia (HFM) is a non-profit umbrella organization supporting re-created historic interpretive units and representing a number of cultures and time periods. "We are not street performers, we are educators. We are not parades, we are historic programs. This is not an exercise in free speech, this is an opportunity to educate. We are not promoting a political agenda, we are promoting the city's history through a practical and factual teaching method". Crisp-Ellert Art Museum at Flagler College Built in honor of Dr. JoAnn Crisp-Ellert and her husband, Dr. Robert Ellert, the Crisp-Ellert Art Museum offers Flagler College students and the Northeast Florida community a venue for fostering knowledge and a deep appreciation of contemporary art. As an educational resource for the College, the Museum exhibits regional, national and international artists, and provides opportunities for critical engagement and exposure to a variety of exhibitions and personal interactions with visiting artists. The Museum challenges students, the Flagler community and the public to cultivate individual creativity, critical reflection, historical consciousness and respect for the free exchange of ideas. In this spirit, the Museum also hosts public programs, including artist talks, readings, panel discussions and film series that provide a platform for vital interdisciplinary dialogue. We offer a range of different roles, depending on the needs of our partners. At events , our most common roles include box office, stewarding, hospitality and customer service roles. Our non event roles range from front of house, barista, catering and logistics positions. Have a look at our events pages to see what roles suit your skills, interests and availability best. What sectors do you support? Ethical Staffing work with a hugely diverse range of clients; Conferences, Sporting Events, Brand activations, World Heritage events, University Graduations, and of course, Live Events and Festivals. We are proud to state that our client portfolio is as diverse as our staffing teams! What is the application process? Want to join our superstar team? First you’ll need to fill out an application form on our recruitment portal. Here you can tell us about your experience & what events you’re interested in. One of our recruitment team will then arrange to have a telephone or Zoom interview with you, and if successful we will set you up on our shift allocation system where you will be able to choose any roles that you are interested in working at, and be the first to find out about exciting new openings! Learn more here. Can I work with my friends? Absolutely! The more the merrier! We can’t guarantee that your shifts / roles will align, but we can do our very best to make it work. Please ensure you mention this when you are contacted by our team at HQ to book in your work. What's in it for me? We truly take pride in supporting our your wellbeing and happiness! At an event, this includes free tea and coffee, snacks and around the clock support from our awesome team of managers. For weekend camping events you will also get perks like a free meal ticket for each shift worked, access to a dedicated crew camping area with hot showers, phone charging points and lots more! “Just wanted to say thanks to you and the team for today. Advertise with Forbes Forbes Licensing & Syndication Report a Security Issue Editorial Values and Standards Site Feedback Contact Us Careers at Forbes Tips Corrections Privacy Do Not Sell My Personal Information Terms AdChoices Reprints & Permissions Business Hollywood & Entertainment Inside The Business Of Rolling Loud Music Festival And Cofounder Matt Zingler By Ogden Payne , Former Contributor. Forbes contributors publish independent expert analyses and insights. I write for, and about, the up-and-coming musician. May 09, 2018, 10:00am EDT Jul 04, 2018, 10:58pm EDT Share Save This article is more than 7 years old. Rolling Loud co-founder Matt Zingler Matias Vasquez A quick scroll through Matt Zingler’s Instagram profile reveals a heavily tattooed twenty-something year old living like a modern day rock star. His photos, most of them professionally taken, exude an anti-establishment, unapologetic energy. Nearly all of them are colorful glimpses into the life of a millennial who rubs shoulders with rappers - and could possibly be mistaken for one himself. But Zingler's bio tells a different story: “Owner/Co-Founder Rolling Loud Festival.” Rolling Loud’s flyer promotes a healthy blend of hip-hop acts, including J. Cole, Future, Lil Wayne, Migos, Wiz Khalifa and 115 of rap’s in-demand performers. The extensive bill justifies the $300-plus general admission price tag, as well as the need to host the festival in the Miami Dolphins’ Hard Rock Stadium, which will hold 40,000 fans over the May 11-13 weekend. “It’s really just a nightclub, just a little bit bigger,” says Zingler, a former nightclub manager. Since its 2015 inception in Miami, Rolling Loud has established its property in Los Angeles and San Francisco, with plans to expand in New York, London, Japan, China, Mexico, Australia and Croatia. “I’m trying to create [a] Starbucks,” he says, explaining his goal of franchising the Rolling Loud festival brand. It’s a tall expectation from a biological science major turned businessman. But Zingler's clout as a concert promoter and festival owner have steadily grown since the birth of his touring company, Dope Entertainment, in 2010. The company’s first at-bat came in the form of an after party for Rick Ross in a Tallahassee nightclub. Though the event lost $30,000, Zingler realized the untapped hip-hop market in the area. He soon switched the business model to promoting concerts with hard ticket sales, and routed a revenue-generating Florida run with New Orleans rapper Curren$y. Zingler, alongside co-founder Tariq Cherif, debuted Rolling Loud in February 2015. Technical difficulties with ticket scanners, 10 inches of rain causing four-hour delays and a mandatory shut down from the fire department yielded a loss financially. Still, fans concluded it was an event worth attending again. Since then, each year has increased in occupancy and turned a profit, largely due to Zingler's ability to assess potential ROI: “Realistically if you have money, you could just leave your money in a bank or put it in a stock market, getting anywhere between 2-8%. So generally speaking, if you were going to do a high-risk investment, you would need to receive more than you would receive in something that’s [low-risk] - such as S&P or leaving your money in a bank. It’s just about scaling, price elasticity and supply and demand. For us as a festival, our ROI ranges between 10-50%. There’s a reason we’re growing at the rate we are.” As well as his ambitious vision of franchising his festival: "When you’re franchising your brand, you obviously want to limit your liabilities but at the same time, it’s the long play. Every company is built to sell, so not necessarily are you looking at a return. You say, hey if I can get this thing going and I lose a little bit, break even, make a little bit, whatever, the value increases because of your data. It’s hard to create new brands. Every brand is just a name initially. After you develop a name and you put value to it with data and a following, any [outside company or brand] can utilize that. When I’m expanding a brand I look at it from the perspective as I’m increasing knowledge of my brand." And his calculated decisions regarding which industries the Rolling Loud brand will dabble in: "Management, label, merchandising, all under the Rolling Loud brand. The future in my opinion is digital. Digital marketing and data and media content. You see everybody fighting over live stream rights. Imagine being able to have a music festival where there’s no such thing as an occupancy anymore because anybody can tune in around the world and pay $20 to watch it." Though the 29-year-old's acumen to process data, assess risk and plan for the future bodes well for the festival's growth, he insists that hospitality shown to artists, managers and booking agents is the signature ingredient for success. When asked if his appearance - tattoos visible from his hands to his neck - has stifled potential business, he claims, “I don’t ever dress up for anybody. I don’t believe in the suit-and-tie method. I believe that the real value is what you have in your head.” He's also hyper-aware that his desires are lofty, but revels in the possibilities. “It’s about how big can we go without sinking the ship.” Editorial Standards Reprints & Permissions LOADING VIDEO PLAYER... Featuring a diverse mix of over 100 national, regional, and local artists, the festival spans multiple weekends in September and includes free and ticketed events across a dozen venues. The marquee event, the Live Wildy Showcase, will be held in downtown St. Augustine on Saturday, September 20, and Sunday, September 21. Accessibility arrow-down-right An ADA platform with accessible seating and sunshade will be available on-site at Francis Field. For assistance, visit the Accessibility Live tent located near the shuttle drop off location in front of the parking garage prior to going through security. ADA bathrooms will also be available. For additional ADA inquiries, please contact: requests@accessibilitylive.com . Additional Programming arrow-down-right As in previous years, Sing Out Loud includes free local artist showcases, community events, select ticketed events, artist development programs, and more. For more details on all programming visit: Events . Address arrow-down-right Sing Out Loud’s Live Wildly Showcase will be held at Francis Field in downtown St. Augustine: 25 West Castillo Drive, St. Augustine, FL 32084 Francis Field is an open-air special events field located in the heart of historic downtown St. Augustine, within walking distance of downtown hotels and biking distance from the beach and historic sites. Free local events will take place at multiple venues around St. Augustine. For more information, please visit: Venues . Age Restrictions arrow-down-right Sing Out Loud Festival’s Live Wildly Showcase is open to all ages but is not recommended for children under 8 years old. Children two and under will be admitted for free with a paid adult. Bag Policy & Cushions arrow-down-right Approved Bags and Cushions: Bags, totes, or purses smaller than 12"x6"x12". Clear plastic bag smaller than one gallon. Non-metal seat cushion without pockets, arms, or zippers. Diaper bag. Medically necessary bags (permitted after proper inspection). Non-approved Bags and Cushions: Backpack. Plastic bag with printed pattern. Metal seat cushion with pockets, arms, or zippers. Over-sized tote bag. CamelBak or hydration pack. Folding chair. Camera case. Umbrella. Soft-sided cooler. Bathrooms arrow-down-right On-site facilities, including ADA facilities, will be available. Box Office & Will Call arrow-down-right Tickets for Sing Out Loud Festival’s Live Wildly Showcase are available exclusively via our official ticketing partner, AXS . Tickets can be purchased via the official Sing Out Loud Festival website, AXS, and in person at The St. Augustine Amphitheatre Box Office. Purchasing tickets from any source other than the official festival website, AXS, or The St. Augustine Amphitheatre Box Office is done at the buyer’s own risk. Tickets purchased through third-party sellers may not be valid for entry and cannot be verified. The Box Office & Will Call will be located at the entrance of the festival grounds, on the corner of Cordova and Orange Street. Box Office Hours: Friday, September 19 from 9am - 5pm Saturday, September 20 from 10am - 9pm Sunday, September 21 from 10am - 9pm Contact Information arrow-down-right CONTACT INFO (SING OUT LOUD FESTIVAL) Email: info@singoutloudfestival.com Phone: (904) 209-3746 CONTACT INFO (TICKETING) For ticketing questions or issues with your ticket order, please visit AXS Support or call AXS at (888) 929-7849. Digital Tickets & Wristbands arrow-down-right General Admission Tickets (1-Day & 2-Day): These are electronic only and must be displayed on a mobile device for festival entry. No wristband will be provided. GA+ and Platinum Tickets (1-Day & 2-Day): In addition to your electronic ticket, you will receive a wristband. You must wear this wristband for entry into the festival and access to exclusive lounges and viewing areas. Please do not tighten your wristband until you're ready—it won't loosen. Important Notes: If your GA, GA+ or Platinum ticket was transferred, you need to create an AXS Fan account (AXS.com) to accept the tickets. Wristbands are issued for GA+ and Platinum ticket tiers only and must be worn to access exclusive lounge and viewing areas. Wristbands should not be put on until just before the event. If tickets are transferred after GA+ and Platinum wristbands have shipped, the original purchaser is responsible for getting the wristband to the new ticket holder. GA+ and Platinum tickets purchased after September 6 will not have wristbands shipped; they will be available for pickup at Festival Will Call. There is a $20 replacement fee for damaged, lost or stolen wristbands. Depending on availability, you may purchase an upgraded ticket from General Admission to GA+ or GA+ to Platinum (1-Day & 2-Day). To upgrade your ticket, please visit the Box Office at Francis Field. You must return your original wristband to avoid a $20 replacement fee. If you have any questions regarding your order or shipping, please visit: AXS Support . Festival App arrow-down-right Download the Sing Out Loud Festival app on your iOS and Android devices to access venue details, personalized schedules, playlists, and Spotify integration. Stay informed with real-time updates on and exclusive app-only promotions such as special deals on merchandise and drinks Festival Environment arrow-down-right This is a standing-only festival; concert seating will not be available. If ADA accommodations are needed, please visit the Info Booth inside the festival grounds. Sun protection and hydration are highly encouraged—please visit the free water refill stations, cooling station and shade structures located around the festival grounds as often as needed. Sing Out Loud Festival Rules: Be respectful of patrons, staff, and our beautiful city and beaches. For your safety and the safety of others, guests and their possessions are subject to search upon entrance. Smoking is only permitted in designated areas. Drink responsibly. Intoxicated persons may be denied admittance to the event. This is a rain or shine event. Food & Beverage arrow-down-right A wide selection of local food and beverage vendors will be onsite including: Antojitos - Mexican Style Fruit & Street Corn Crepe Crazy - Sweet & Savory Crepes Dragon Banh Mi - Vietnamese Sandwiches & Dragon Tots Green Leaf Lumpia - Filipino Flavors Hyppo - Gourmet Ice Pops I Love Perogies - Perogies & Polish Sausage Mr. Frostee - Soft Serve Ice Cream Pani Puri Tuk Tuk - Indian Food Saucy Pig - BBQ Shadrach's Fiery Furnace - Wood Fire Pizza So Good Mochi - Mochi & Paleta Three Moons - Tacos & Rice Bowls Uncle KC Dogs - Gourmet Hot Dogs Yamo - Italian Street Food Hotels & Accommodations arrow-down-right Check out our Accommodation Partners for convenient hotel options near the festival. Lineup & Hours arrow-down-right Sing Out Loud Festival’s Live Wildly Showcase will take place September 20 & 21, 2025 in historic downtown St. Augustine, FL. Additional details on the event schedule will be released closer to the event. Saturday, September 20: Beabadoobee, Vance Joy, Father John Misty, Maren Morris, David Kushner, & Sarah Kinsley. Sunday, September 21: Hozier, The Teskey Brothers, Rilo Kiley, Gigi Perez, sombr, & Brenn!. *Please Note: Lineup and times are subject to change Media Requests arrow-down-right For press and media requests, please visit: Apply . Merch arrow-down-right Sing Out Loud Festival merchandise is available online. Visit Merch to get your exclusive gear before the festival. Merchandise will also be available onsite at the festival. Parking & Shuttle Services arrow-down-right Due to the closure of the Historic Downtown Parking Facility, there will be no onsite parking at the festival. Attendees as well as anyone else who would otherwise use the garage are strongly encouraged to use free satellite parking with shuttle service, rideshare, walking, or biking. All shuttles are free, ADA accessible, and run continuously during operating hours. A parking map can be found here and shuttle map here . Historic Downtown Parking Facility Closure The Historic Downtown Parking Facility will be closed to the public during the festival weekend. To help ease access to downtown, free shuttle services will be available to all — including festival attendees, downtown employees, and general visitors. Closure & Shuttle Details: Friday, September 19: Open for entry until 7:00 PM. Vehicles already parked may still exit after this time. Shuttle service from Broudy’s Parking Lot (212 West King St.) will run 7:00 PM – 11:00 PM. Saturday, September 20: Closed to the public – please use shuttle services. Sunday, September 21: Closed to the public – please use shuttle services. Reminder : Shuttle services are free, ADA accessible, and run continuously throughout posted lot hours. Walking, biking, and shared rides are also encouraged. Satellite Parking & Shuttle Hours The lots below are free, and available to all, to use with continuous shuttle service. For more information on Sing Out Loud partnerships, please call Dianya Markovits at (352) 256-4455 or email dmarkovits@theamp.com. Re-entry arrow-down-right Festival attendees will be permitted to leave and re-enter the festival. However, they must display their digital tickets upon re-entry and are subject to search. Safety & Prohibited Items arrow-down-right For the safety of fans, artists, guests, and staff, certain items are not allowed within the festival grounds. Guests and their belongings are subject to search upon entry or re-entry. Prohibited items include: Audio or Video Recording Equipment Backpacks Bags exceeding 12" x 6" x 12" Blankets exceeding 45" x 60" Coolers Drones Fireworks Flashlights or Laser Pointers Glass or metal bottles Illegal Drugs iPads or Laptops Large or professional cameras with detachable lenses Pets (only certified service animals are allowed) Weapons of any kind Ticketing arrow-down-right AXS is the official ticketing partner for the Sing Out Loud Festival. Purchasing tickets from any source other than the official festival website, AXS, or The St. Augustine Amphitheatre Box Office is done at the buyer’s own risk. Tickets purchased through third-party sellers may not be valid for entry and cannot be verified. If you have any questions regarding your order or shipping, visit AXS Support . TICKET TYPES For more information on ticket types and pricing, please visit: Box Office & Ticketing . TRANSFERRING TICKETS A ticket transfer allows you to digitally send each guest in your party their own ticket via AXS at no additional cost. Important Transfer Information: Digital tickets cannot be transferred until fulfillment is complete in August. GA+ and Platinum ticket transfers require the recipient to create an AXS Fan Account to accept the ticket. How Ticket Transfers Work: Click the Transfer button next to the event in your AXS account. Select the tickets to transfer and enter the recipient’s information. On the review page, click the Transfer button to send the tickets. The recipient will receive an email about the transfer and must create an AXS account (if they don’t already have one) to accept the tickets. Once completed, the tickets will be accessible via the AXS app . Ticket Types & Tiers arrow-down-right TICKET PRICING & PERKS Tickets for the Sing Out Loud Festival’s Live Wildly Showcase are exclusively available via our official ticketing partner, AXS . Secure your tickets through the official Sing Out Loud Festival Website, directly from AXS, or in person at The St. Augustine Amphitheatre Box Office. Purchasing tickets from sources other than these official channels is done at the buyer’s own risk. Tickets purchased through third-party sellers may not be valid for entry and cannot be verified. Water Bottles arrow-down-right Bring your own empty, clear, reusable plastic water bottle to fill at our free filtered water stations throughout the festival. Both still and sparkling water will be available. Single-use plastic, metal, and glass containers are not permitted. Weather Plan arrow-down-right This event is rain or shine. In case of inclement weather, safety is our priority. Any delays or changes due to weather will be communicated to ticket holders via email, social media, the app, and our website. Waitlist arrow-down-right 1. How the Waitlist Works When does the waitlist open? As soon as a ticket type sells out, the waitlist opens for that item. Is joining the waitlist a guarantee? Joining the waitlist does not guarantee fulfillment. All requests are subject to availability. How are waitlist requests processed? Requests are fulfilled on a first-come, first-served basis. Can I see where I am in line? No. The system does not show your position in the queue. 2. Pricing & Payment Are waitlist ticket prices higher? No. All waitlist tickets are offered at standard pricing and are not subject to dynamic pricing. What is the deposit and how does it work? A waitlist ticket requires a $20 deposit, plus a $10 service fee. If your order is fulfilled, the deposit is applied to your total. If not, the deposit will be refunded within 7–10 days after the festival. The service fee is non-refundable. Will I be charged automatically? Yes. If your request is fulfilled, your payment method will be charged the remaining balance automatically. Are payment plans available? No. Payment plans are not offered for waitlist orders. 3. Order Updates & Cancellations How will I know if my request is fulfilled? You’ll receive an email from AXS, so check your inbox regularly and monitor your FanAccount. What if my card fails or is expired? If a charge fails, your request may not be retried and you’ll lose your place in line — be sure your payment method is valid. Can I cancel my waitlist request? Yes. You can cancel unwanted items anytime via FanAccount before they’re fulfilled. Can I change my order after it's fulfilled? No. All sales are final once your order is processed. Contact Us Festival and Event Staff Hotbox Events recruits and manages festival and event staff for festivals across the UK. The first event we worked with was Leeds Festival in 2003, since then we've grown from supplying a small team of just 6 staff to over three thousand stewards every year! If you run a festival or event and would lik e more information about the festival and event staff Hotbox Events can provide please contact us . Our festival and event staffing experience Our management team has been recruiting and managing festival and event staff across the UK since the early 90s. We supply and manage teams of up to 900 at the festivals we work with, helping in the campsites, on fire towers, gates, wristband exchanges, entrances and in the arenas. Festival and Event Staff Our festival and event staff services Our event teams provide support and customer service to festival and event goers, whilst working with other onsite agencies to help reduce crime and keep ticket holders safe. The key areas our festival and event staff assist with include: Working in campsites, arenas, on gates, fire towers, and wristband exchanges. Our staff are the eyes and ears of a festival or event; trained to be proactive and alert to any potential problem. Promoting crime awareness and crime prevention to the public. Working with onsite teams to ensure medical, fire and security issues are dealt with promptly and safely. Helping to prevent overcrowding and on hand to monitor crowd safety. Assisting the public to create an environment where they feel safe. Directing the public, assisting with ingress and egress to help the process run smoothly and effectively. Supporting ticket holders, providing information about the event including facilities and performances to ensure they have the best possible time at your event. Search Home News Flash Module Search Enter Search Terms All categories News Flash Home - Fire Department Tools RSS Notify Me® Categories All Categories News Flash Home - Fire Department News Flash News Flash Posted on: September 13, 2024 Sing Out Loud offers free shuttles, parking On Saturday, September 21 and Sunday, September 22, the Sing Out Loud Live Wildly Showcase will host multiple performances on Francis Field... here's what you need to know for parking and road closures. Reminder of parking garage closure and closure of nearby streets On Saturday, September 21 and Sunday, September 22, the Sing Out Loud Festival will host multiple performances on Francis Field, impacting parking and adjacent road access. Here is what you need to know: Road Closures The following road closures will take place beginning Friday, September 20 through Monday, September 23: Cordova Street , North from Orange Street to the entrance of the parking garage Closed Friday at 5:00pm through Monday at 6:00am Castillo Drive eastbound Closed Friday night at 11:00pm through Monday at 6:00am Castillo Drive westbound from San Marco Closed Saturday at 11:00am through Sunday at 1:00am Closed Sunday at 11:00am through Monday at 1:00am Orange Street Closed to through traffic Friday at 5:00pm through Monday at 6:00am There will be security on Orange Street to make sure that the residents can get in and out as they need to. Parking: Garage and Shuttle Service Starting Friday, September 20, at 11:00pm, through Monday, September 23, at 1:00am the Historic Downtown Parking Facility will be closed to the public. Free parking and shuttle service will be provided to the Visitor Information Center, from three parking locations: Broudy’s Lot, 198 & 212 W. King St. , located at the intersection of US1 and King Street Saturday, Sept. 21 and Sunday, Sept. 22 beginning at 8:00am until 12:00am St. Johns County Health Department, 200 San Sebastian View Saturday, Sept. 21 and Sunday, Sept. 22 beginning at 11:00am until 12:00am San Marco Lot, 301 San Marco Ave . Saturday, Sept. 21 and Sunday, Sept. 22 beginning at 11:00am until 12:00am Colonial Church Lot, 550 State Road 207 Saturday, Sept. 21 and Sunday, Sept. 22 beginning at 2:00pm to 12:00am STAR Circulator STAR Circulator will operate from Noon to Midnight on both Saturday, September 21 and Sunday, September 22.   The STAR Circulator will resume normal hours of operation, from 10:00am to 10:00pm, on Monday, September 23. Contact Parking questions may be directed to the City of St. Augustine Mobility Department at 904-315-9472 or via email at mobility@citystaug.com . Inquiries for the Sing Out Loud Festival may be directed to 904.209.3746 or send an email to ampinfo@theamp.com . Media inquiries about city-related impacts may be directed to Melissa Wissel, Communications Director, at 904.293.3307 or via email to mwissel@citystaug.com . ⇐ Previous Public meetings continue for
